greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of unlabeled series-reduced rooted trees with n nodes where the non-leaf branches directly under any given node are all equal.
comment: This is a weaker condition than achirality (cf. A167865).
A rooted tree is series-reduced if every non-leaf node has at least two branches.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
example: The a(3) = 1 through a(8) = 9 rooted trees:
program: (PARI) seq(n)={my(v=vector(n)); v[1]=1; for(n=3, n, v[n] = 1 + sum(k=2, n-2, (n-1)\k*v[k])); v} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 26 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 08 2018
